dcsControllerServer.objectDictionary module¶

class dcsControllerServer.objectDictionary.objectDictionary(logger, direct_access=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class which represents an object dictionary and manages its entries

Check if index exists in object dictionary

Parameters:index (int) – Index of OD entry
__getitem__(key)[source]¶

Adress an entry via its index

Parameters:index (int) – Index of OD entry
Returns:OD entry with specified index
Return type:odEntry
Raises:IndexError – If index is not part of object dictionary

Initialize an empty object dictionary

Parameters:
  • logger (Logger) – A Logger object for logging purposes
  • direct_access (bool) – True makes it possible to write on all entries

Create an iterator to loop over all entries

__len__()[source]¶

Number of all defined top level entries

__next__()[source]¶

Loop over defined indices

Returns:OD entry at this index
Return type:odEntry
Raises:StopIteration – If there are no more defined indices left
__setitem__(index, val)[source]¶

Try to set the value of an entry

Parameters:
  • index (int) – Index of the entry
  • val – Value to be written
Raises:

IndexError – If index is not part of object dictionary
addEntry(index, entrytype, datatype=None, attribute=None, description='', default=None, comment='')[source]¶

Add an odEntry to the object dictionary if index is still free

Parameters:
  • index (int) – The index of the odEntry to be added
  • entrytype (ENTRYTYPE) – Object type of the object to be added.
  • datatype (VARTYPE, optional) – Data type if single value entry.
  • attribute (ATTR, optional) – Access attribute if single value entry.
  • description (str, optional) – Name of the entry to be added. Defaults to ''.
  • default – Default value if single value entry. Defaults to None.
  • comment (str, optional) – Additional comment on this entry. Defaults to ''.
Raises:

IndexError – If index is already defined
direct_access¶
entries¶

List of entries where not defined entries are None

classmethod from_eds(logger, source, node_id, direct_access=False)[source]¶

Import an existing object dictionary form an eds file

It may happen that not all features of the eds format ar supported by this method. In this case the logger displays an ERROR message.

Parameters:
  • logger (Logger) – A Logger object for obvious purposes
  • source – A file-like object or the path to the eds file
  • node_id (int) – The node-id to which this object dictionary shall belong
  • direct_access (bool) – True makes it possible to write on all entries
indices¶

All currently used indices in this OD

parse_value(datatype, node_id)[source]¶

Parse a value from an eds file

Parameters:
  • val_as_string (str) – The value gotten from the config parser
  • datatype (ATTR) – Datatype of the entry
Returns:

The value in an appropiate type
class dcsControllerServer.objectDictionary.odEntry(index, entrytype, logger, datatype=None, attribute=None, description='', default=None, comment='', direct_access=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Object dictionary entry

This class represents a top level entry of an object dictionary. Its value may be modified if it defined as writable.

__index¶

int – Index of this OD entry

__entrytype¶

ENTRYTYPE – Object type of this OD entry

__attribute¶

ATTR – Access attribute if entry is single value entry. If not so, it defaults to None.

__default¶

Default value if entry is single value entry

description¶

str – Name of this OD entry

logger¶

Logger – A Logger object for logging purposes

comment¶

str – Additional comment describing this entry

__contains__(subindex)[source]¶

Checks if this entry has a certain subentry

Parameters:subindex (int) – The subindex to look for
__getitem__(key)[source]¶

Get a subentry

Parameters:(obj (key) – int): index of the subentry
Returns:The subentry
Return type:odSubEntry
__init__(index, entrytype, logger, datatype=None, attribute=None, description='', default=None, comment='', direct_access=False)[source]¶

Inizialize a top-level OD entry

Parameters:
  • index (int) – The index the OD entry shall be initialized with
  • entrytype (ENTRYTYPE) – Object type of this OD entry.
  • logger (Logger) – A Logger object for logging purposes
  • datatype (VARTYPE, optional) – Data type if entry is single value entry (Defaults to None)
  • attribute (ATTR, optional) – Access attribute if entry is single value entry (Defaults to None)
  • description (str, optional) – Name of the OD entry (Defaults to ‘’)
  • default (optional) – Default value if entry is single value entry (Defaults to None)
  • comment (str) – Additional comment (Defaults to ‘’)
  • direct_access (bool) – True makes it possible to write on all entries
__iter__()[source]¶

Loop over all subentries

__len__()[source]¶

Length of entry

Returns:The number of subentries
Return type:int
__repr__()[source]¶

Create a string with python syntax

__setitem__(key, val)[source]¶

Try to write the value of a subentry

Parameters:
  • key (int) – Index of the subentry
  • val – Value to write
__str__()[source]¶

Create a string containing the index and object type

addSubEntry(subindex, vartype, attribute, description='', default=None, comment='')[source]¶

Add a sub entry to the current OD top level entry

Parameters:
  • subindex (int) – Subindex to be added. Subindeces must be continuous.
  • vartype (VARTYPE) – Data type of future subentry
  • attribute (ATTR) – Access attribute
  • description (str, optional) – Name of subentry. Defaults to ''.
  • default (optional) – Default value. Defaults to None.
  • comment (str, optional) – Additional comment on subentry. Defaults to ''.
Raises:
  • AttributeError – If top level entry is of type obj:ENTRYTYPE.VAR
  • ValueError – If subindex is not continuous with previous subindeces
attribute¶

Access attribute to data object

Returns None if entry is not object ENTRYTYPE.VAR.

datatype¶

Data type of OD entry

Returns None if entry is not object ENTRYTYPE.VAR.

default¶

Default value of OD entry

entrytype¶

Object definition of OD entry

index¶

OD index

subentries¶

List of odSubEntry belonging to this odEntry

value¶

Value of OD entry

class dcsControllerServer.objectDictionary.odSubEntry(master, subindex, logger, vartype=None, attribute=None, description='', default=None, comment='', reserved=False, direct_access=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Low level object dictionary entry

__init__(master, subindex, logger, vartype=None, attribute=None, description='', default=None, comment='', reserved=False, direct_access=False)[source]¶

Initialize a low level OD entry

Parameters:
  • master (odEntry) – Top level entry for this subentry. This is needed because this entry has to know its main index.
  • (obj (subindex) – int): Subindex to be initialized with
  • vartype (VARTYPE) – Data type of this entry.
  • attribute (ATTR) – Access attribute for this entry
  • logger (Logger) – A Logger object for logging purposes
  • description (str, optional) – Name of this entry. Defaults to ''.
  • default (optional) – Default value of this entry. Defaults to None.
  • comment (str, optional) – Additional comment for this entry. Defaults to ''.
  • direct_access (bool) – True makes it possible to write on all entries
__repr__()[source]¶

String containing index, subindex and data type

__str__()[source]¶

String containing index, subindex, data type and value

attribute¶

Access attribute for this entry

default¶

Default value of this entry

index¶

int – Top level index of this entry

reserved¶

bool – If this is a reserved subentry

subindex¶

int – Low level index of this entry

value¶

Data value of entry

vartype¶

Data type of this entry
